name: Red Curry Green Beans Thai Pad Prik King
description: Red Curry Green Beans - Green Beans Stir fry with red curry paste, kaffir lime, sugar and chile. Pad Prik King Vegan Glutenfree Soyfree Nutfree Recipe
recipeIngredient: Bunch  Green Beans (2 to 3 cups, chopped into 3 to 4 inch size)
3-4 tbsp red curry paste (use a fish free brand)
2 tsp soy sauce (or use coconut aminos + some tamarind paste to make soy-free)
1 tbsp kaffir lime leaves or zest of half a lime
1/4 tsp or more cayenne or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Blanch the green beans for 2 minutes, drain and keep aside. If using thinner beans like haricot verts, blanch for 1 minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Blanch the green beans for 2 minutes, drain and keep aside. If using thinner beans like haricot verts, blanch for 1 minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium low heat. Add garlic and cook until translucent. 2 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium low heat. Add garlic and cook until translucent. 2 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the red curry paste and mix and cook until fragrant . 1 minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the red curry paste and mix and cook until fragrant . 1 minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the soy sauce, lemon, lime leaves or zest, water, sugar, cayenne and salt and mix well. Increase heat to medium. Cook for a minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the soy sauce, lemon, lime leaves or zest, water, sugar, cayenne and salt and mix well. Increase heat to medium. Cook for a minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the green beans. toss to coat. Cover and cook for 3 to 6 minutes or until tender to preference.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the green beans. toss to coat. Cover and cook for 3 to 6 minutes or until tender to preference.

recipeInstructions.text: Taste and adjust salt, sweet, and spice. I added some red pepper flakes as the curry paste I use is not hot. Serve hot with rice or noodles or cooked grains of choice. The beans can also be garnished with crushed peanuts or almonds and cilantro.
